thread.title: 'Top Chef’ to lead shore excursions on Celebrity sailing
thread.title_full: 'Top Chef’ to lead shore excursions on Celebrity sailing

author: Larry Bleiberg, Special for USA TODAY
title: 'Top Chef’ to lead shore excursions on Celebrity sailing
text:
Celebrity Cruises is extending and expanding its partnership with Bravo TV's hit show, Top Chef. (Photo: Celebrity Cruises)
Tags Celebrity Cruises Cooking classes Celebrity Reflection Top Chef Bravo TV 1 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE You’ll continue to find celebrity chefs on Celebrity Cruises with the line extending its “Top Chef at Sea” partnership with the Bravo Media show into 2016. A constellation of kitchen crusaders will be joining passengers on the special sailings this year, including a November 14 Celebrity Reflection Eastern Caribbean trip, which will feature chef-led shore excursions.
USA TODAY
In first, American woman to take helm of giant cruise ship
Guests include: Chris Crary, Top Chef Texas contestant and Executive Chef of Hyde Sunset Kitchen + Cocktails in Los Angeles; Doug Adams, Top Chef Boston finalist and Chef de Cuisine of Imperial and Portland (Ore.) Penny Diner; Gregory Gourdet, Top Chef Boston runner-up and Executive Chef at Departure Restaurant + Lounge in Portland, Ore.; Ash Fulk, Top Chef Las Vegas contestant and Culinary Director at Hill Country Hospitality in New York; Tiffany Derry, Top Chef D.C., Top Chef All-Stars contestant and owner of TD Concepts, Inc.; and Nina Compton, Top Chef New Orleans runner-up
Other activities include new duel-style cooking demonstrations where so-called "cheftestants" compete while answering fans' questions, with the winning dish chosen by the audience. Passengers can also book private cooking classes and private dinners.
Celebrity will also continue to offer interactive Quickfire Challenges, letting passengers try their hand at cooking competitions. In addition, Top Chef-inspired items will be served on sailings through June 2016. For more information, visit: celebritycruises.com .
For a deck-by-deck look inside the Celebrity Reflection, click through the carousel below.
The exterior of the Celebrity Reflection, the fifth and final ship in the Solstice Class line that began in 2008. Michael Wessels Fullscreen The exterior of the Celebrity Reflection, the fifth and final ship in the Solstice Class line. The ship made her North American debut on Dec. 1 with a sailing out of Miami. Michael Wessels Fullscreen The outdoor pool on Deck 14 has a pool bar, two pools, and Jacuzzis. Chairs were added to the deck of the Reflection to accommodate more guests. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen An extra 245 loungers were added to the expanded pool deck to accommodate more than 1,000 additional guests than the Reflection's predecessors in the Solstice line have had. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Pool Bar is located on Deck 14. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Weather permitting, the Mast Grill on Deck 15 is a casual dining spot where guests can have grilled specialties while overlooking the pool. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests take a Zumba class by the outdoor pool on Deck 14. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The iLounge has 22 computers that guests can use to surf the Internet. The lounge is also a licensed Apple reseller, one of the first at sea. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The expanded Aqua Spa offers a wide range of services including massages, 24K gold facials, and a full Medi-Spa where guests can get acupuncture and other treatments. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The enhanced AquaSpa by Elemis has a number of specialty areas such as a hammam, infrared sauna, steam rooms, and sensory showers. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen A treatment room at the AquaSpa where guests can get a variety of types of massages including a bamboo massage. Therapists experiment with lights and scents to help create different moods. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The AquaSpa has an expanded 883 square-foot Persian Garden with six more curved, heated tiled beds. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The cold room at the AquaSpa is kept at 52 degrees F to tighten pores that were opened and cleansed in the infrared sauna or aromatic steam room. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests can get manicures, pedicures and haircuts in the salon. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen A state-of-the art fitness facility features cardio machines, spinning studios, and private workout areas. Classes and bootcamps are also available. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The fitness center is equipped with TechnoGym equipment that is available for trial and purchase. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The fitness center has been expanded to include four new studios. Personal training sessions are also available. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests who don't want to swim outdoors have the option of swimming in the indoor pool. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deck 14 has whimsical seating such as this cushioned hammock by the pool. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Sky Observation Lounge is one of more than a dozen drinking establishments on the Reflection. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen By day, the Sky Observation Lounge is a place to relax over a cocktail. At night, the dance floor gets packed. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Sky Observation Lounge offers expansive views from Deck 14. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Oceanview Café on Deck 14 gives guests the options of a buffet meal for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Oceanview Café has buffet-style dining in an indoor and outdoor setting for 885 people. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests have a variety of options at the buffet-style Oceanview Cafe, including complimentary pasta, pizza, soups, sandwiches, sushi, salad, and frozen yogurt. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Cafe al Bacio offers pastries and specialty coffees and seats 54. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Cafe Gelateria offers an assortment of traditional gelatos. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Live music is played at the low-key Ensemble Lounge on Deck 5. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Ensemble Lounge has comfortable seating for pre- or after-dinner drinks. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Qsine is one of the specialty restaurants and seats 90 people. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Qsine, a specialty restaurant, has an eclectic menu that includes lobster and escargot fritters and sushi lollipops. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Qsine, a specialty restaurant, has whimsical items such as chocolate-covered strawberry lollipops. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Qsine, a specialty restaurant, seats 90 people. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Tuscan Grille is another specialty restaurant that offers Italian cuisine and steaks and seats 144 people. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Tuscan Grille is another specialty restaurant that offers Italian cuisine and steaks and seats 144 people. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Murano, one of five specialty restaurants on the Reflection, offers modern Continental cuisine. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Murano offers items such as lobster bisque, caviar, lobster and duck breast. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Murano, a specialty restaurant that seats 76 people, has an extensive wine collection. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Bistro on Five is Celebrity's creperie, with tableside service for lunch and dinner. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Bistro on Five, a creperie, seats 72. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Bistro on Five, a 72-seat creperie. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Bistro on Five, a 72-seat creperie. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen Blu is Celebrity's healthy food eatery designed for guests in AquaClass suites. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Blu, a specialty restaurant designed for AquaClass guests, seats 152. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Molecular bar is one of more than a dozen drinking establishments on the ship. It is located on Deck 5. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Martini Bar & Crush on Deck 4 is a popular pre- and post-dinner bar. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Martini Bar & Crush on Deck 4 is a popular pre- and post-dinner bar. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Martini Bar & Crush has an ice bar. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Sunset Bar is located in the aft of the ship. Nancy Trejos Fullscreen The Sunset Bar is located in the aft of the ship. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Sunset Bar is located in the aft of the ship. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen There are eight private cabana-style alcoves on the Lawn Club on Deck 15 that are available for a daily fee. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Lawn Club is a half-acre of manicured, real grass on the top of the ship. Guests can play bocce ball or croquet on the lawn. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Oversized lawn chairs are located on the Lawn Club. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Lawn Club is a half-acre of manicured, real grass on the top of the ship. It is designed to evoke a country club feel. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Porch is a casual dining spot overlooking the lawn that offers breakfast and lunch paninis. It seats 48. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Lawn Club Grill is a specialty restaurant where guests can assist the chef in making their own pizzas and grilled meats. It seats 78. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Lawn Club Grill is a specialty restaurant where guests can assist the chef in making their own pizzas and grilled meats. It seats 78. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Guests in the AquaClass stateroom get unlimited access to the AquaSpa's Persian Garden and complimentary dining at the Blu specialty restaurant. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests in the AquaClass stateroom get priority boarding and debarkation. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests in the penthouse get a complimentary meal at one of the specialty restaurants for every 7-night cruise. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen A bathroom in the penthouse suite, which also has a Jacuzzi . Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bedroom in the 1,291 square-foot penthouse suite. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The penthouse suite has a 385 square-foot veranda. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The penthouse suite's wraparound veranda has a Jacuzzi in it. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen A spa-inspired shower in the penthouse suite. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The 590 square-foot Royal Suite has a dining area. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Royal Suite has a bathtub and a shower. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are eight Royal Suites in the Reflection. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Royal Suite sleeps up to four people. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Royal Suite has a 153 square-foot veranda. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Some of the staterooms have pullout sleeper sofas. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests in the new AquaClass Suite have a spa concierge to arrange personal AquaSpa treatments. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests in the AquaClassSuite get complimentary bottled water and a carafe of flavor-infused iced tea. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The AquaClassSuite has a Hansgrohe shower panel. Guests also get a spa kit with foot spray, lip balm, and a relaxation mist. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests in the AquaClassSuite get luxury Bulgari bath amenities. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are five new Signature Suites in the Reflection. They have elaborate minibars with a wine storage area. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The new Signature Suite is located in a private corridor that requires keycard access. Michel Verdure, Celebrity Reflection Fullscreen The new 1,636-square-foot Reflection Suite has a 194-square-foot veranda and can accommodate up to six guests. Michel Verdure, Celebrity Reflection Fullscreen The Celebrity Reflection has the brand's first two-bedroom suite called the Reflection Suite. Michel Verdure, Celebrity Reflection Fullscreen The highlight of the Reflection Suite is a sea-view bathroom with a rain shower that juts out over the edge of the ship. Michel Verdure, Celebrity Reflection Fullscreen The new Reflection Suite has comfortable seating in a living room with panoramic views of the sea. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen A Reflection Suite bathtub. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Reflection Suite bar. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Hideaway is a quiet area where guests can get away to read or listen to music. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Art Studio offers a variety of classes throughout the day. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Hideaway is a quiet area where guests can get away to read or listen to music. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Fortunes Casino is located on Deck 4. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Library on decks 10 and 11 is open 24 hours. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen Fortunes Casino is located on Deck 4. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests can take art classes in the Art Studio. Elizabeth Ashwell Fullscreen The Reflection has a number of high-end retail stored including Michael Kors and Bulgari. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Reflection has a number of high-end retail stores including Michael Kors and Bulgari. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Reflection has a number of high-end retail stores including Michael Kors and Bulgari. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Reflection has about $60 million worth of art on board. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Reflection's extensive art collection includes this life-sized photograph of a human silhouette by Japanese artist Yuki Onodera. It is called Rosa. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests lounge in chairs by the indoor pool. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen Guests can choose from a variety of shore excursions at ports of call. Nancy Trejos, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Celebrity Reflection had her North American debut in Miami on Dec. 1. She will set sail on Caribbean cruises this winter. Bleiberg is serving as Guest Editor of The Cruise Log while USA TODAY Cruise Editor Gene Sloan is away.
